title: Table of Contents - Usage Examples
description: Auto-generated navigation from page headings with smooth scrolling, sticky positioning, and active state tracking

examples.name: Basic Blog TOC (H2-H3 Only)
examples.description: Simple table of contents for blog posts showing only H2 and H3 headings with smooth scroll
examples.visualDescription: Unordered list with 'Table of Contents' heading, links to H2 main sections and nested H3 subsections, smooth 420ms scroll
examples.useCase: Blog posts, articles, tutorials, long-form content with 2-level hierarchy

headingSelectorNotes.selectorH1: Usually false (page title, only one H1 per page for SEO)
headingSelectorNotes.selectorH4-H6: false for simple blog posts (too much nesting)
headingSelectorNotes.recommendation: H2-H3 provides clean 2-level navigation for most blog posts

smoothScrollNotes.smoothScroll: Enable smooth animated scroll instead of instant jump
smoothScrollNotes.scrollOffset: 0px (increase to 60-100px if you have fixed header)
smoothScrollNotes.calculation: scrollOffset should match header height to prevent content hiding behind fixed header

examples.name: Documentation TOC (All Headings, Style-1 Line Indicators)
examples.description: Comprehensive TOC for documentation showing all 6 heading levels with left line indicators and ordered list
examples.visualDescription: Ordered list with FontAwesome list icon, vertical line indicators on left, purple active state, numbers 1. 2. 3.
examples.useCase: Technical documentation, API docs, knowledge bases, developer guides, comprehensive content with deep nesting

style1Notes.visualStyle: Vertical line to left of each link (::before pseudo-element)
style1Notes.activeStateTracking: Uses Intersection Observer to detect which heading is in viewport
style1Notes.linePlacement: ::before pseudo-element positioned absolutely to left of link

childToggleNotes.ChildToggle: true enables clickable nested heading collapse/expand (like accordion)
childToggleNotes.behavior: Click H2 to show/hide nested H3-H6 items
childToggleNotes.icon: Uses FontAwesome chevron icons for expand/collapse indicators
childToggleNotes.defaultState: All expanded by default (controlled by DefaultToggle responsive object)

examples.name: Sticky Sidebar TOC with Scrollable Max Height
examples.description: Fixed position TOC that stays visible on scroll with custom scrollbar for long content
examples.visualDescription: Fixed sidebar widget with max height 600px, custom purple scrollbar, style-2 bordered list, sticky to viewport
examples.useCase: Long articles, documentation, sidebar widgets, sticky navigation for desktop readers

fixedPositionNotes.fixedPosition: true makes TOC sticky/fixed (position: fixed CSS)
fixedPositionNotes.fixedOffset: 120px = distance from top of viewport (header height + padding)
fixedPositionNotes.calculation: If header is 80px tall, fixedOffset = 80px header + 40px padding = 120px
fixedPositionNotes.placement: Typically in sidebar column (25-30% width) with main content (70-75% width)
fixedPositionNotes.responsive: Set DefaultToggle.xs: false to hide on mobile (not enough screen width)

maxHeightScrollbar.TableMinHeight: 600px max height (adjust based on viewport height, 400-800px typical)
maxHeightScrollbar.webkitOnly: Custom scrollbar works in Chrome/Safari/Edge, Firefox uses default
maxHeightScrollbar.overflow: Automatically becomes overflow-y: auto when content exceeds TableMinHeight

style2Notes.visualStyle: Left border on each list item (border-left)
style2Notes.LineWidth: Normal border width (2-4px for inactive items)
style2Notes.Line2Width: Active border width (4-8px for current section, thicker = more emphasis)
style2Notes.bottomOffset: Spacing between items (8-15px for breathing room)

examples.name: Collapsible Mobile-Friendly TOC
examples.description: Responsive TOC collapsed on mobile, expanded on desktop with toggle icons
examples.visualDescription: Heading with toggle icon (minus/plus), click to expand/collapse content list, auto-collapsed on phones
examples.useCase: Mobile-first content, responsive designs, space-saving layouts, blogs read on phones

toggleIconNotes.ToggleIcon: true enables clickable heading to expand/collapse entire TOC list
toggleIconNotes.openIcon: FontAwesome icon shown when list is expanded (chevron-up, minus, angle-up)
toggleIconNotes.closeIcon: FontAwesome icon shown when list is collapsed (chevron-down, plus, angle-down)
toggleIconNotes.clickTarget: Entire tpgb-toc-heading div is clickable, icon rotates on toggle
toggleIconNotes.animation: Smooth expand/collapse with CSS transition (0.3s default)

defaultToggleResponsive.xs: false = collapsed on mobile (<768px) - saves vertical space
defaultToggleResponsive.mobileBehavior: On phones, TOC starts collapsed, user taps to expand
defaultToggleResponsive.desktopBehavior: On desktop, TOC visible by default for quick navigation

examples.name: Style-3 Dotted Line Indicators TOC
examples.description: Table of contents with horizontal dotted line connecting items to numbers (classic book style)
examples.visualDescription: List with horizontal dotted lines from heading text to section numbers on right, style-3 classic layout
examples.useCase: Books, e-books, academic papers, classic/traditional content presentation

style3Notes.visualStyle: Horizontal dotted/dashed line before nested items (classic book TOC style)
style3Notes.classicLook: Pair with serif fonts (Georgia, Times New Roman) for book-like appearance

bookStyleTips.fontFamily: Georgia serif font for traditional book aesthetic
bookStyleTips.bottomBorder: 2px solid border under heading mimics chapter title underline

examples.name: Style-4 Active State Tracking with Thick Progress Line
examples.description: Modern TOC with vertical progress line that thickens and changes color for active section
examples.visualDescription: Vertical line on left, thin gray for inactive, thick purple for active section being read, smooth transitions
examples.useCase: Modern websites, SaaS documentation, tech blogs, interactive reading experiences

style4Notes.visualStyle: Vertical line on left of nested items, animated width change on active state
style4Notes.LineWidth: Normal line width (1-3px for inactive sections)
style4Notes.Line2Width: Active line width (4-8px, 3x LineWidth recommended for dramatic effect)
style4Notes.transition: Smooth CSS transition on width change (0.3s default)
style4Notes.positioning: ::before pseudo-element uses left: calc() to center thick line over thin line
style4Notes.Style4Padding: Left padding for nested .toc-list (5-15px typical, controls indentation)

activeStateTracking.mechanism: Intersection Observer API monitors heading visibility in viewport
activeStateTracking.threshold: Adds .is-active-li class when heading enters viewport top 20%
activeStateTracking.scrollSync: TOC updates as you scroll, highlights current section automatically
activeStateTracking.multipleActive: If multiple headings visible, highlights topmost heading
activeStateTracking.performance: Intersection Observer is efficient, no scroll event listeners needed

gradientHeadingNotes.TextBg: Gradient background for modern branded look
gradientHeadingNotes.TextNormalColor: White text on gradient (ensure WCAG contrast 4.5:1 minimum)
gradientHeadingNotes.borderRadiusTopOnly: Rounded top corners, square bottom blends into content list

examples.name: Custom Selector with Nested Child Headings and Gradient
examples.description: TOC targeting specific content area with nested child heading collapse and modern gradient styling
examples.visualDescription: Purple gradient heading with 'Article Outline', nested H2-H4 with collapsible children, custom .main-article selector
examples.useCase: Multi-section pages, custom post types, specific content areas, branded navigation widgets

customSelectorNotes.contentSelector: CSS selector for content area to scan for headings
customSelectorNotes.multipleSections: Use comma-separated: '.content, .sidebar' to scan multiple areas
customSelectorNotes.specificity: More specific selectors avoid scanning unwanted headings (header, footer, etc.)

nestedChildToggleNotes.ChildToggle: true enables nested heading collapse (H3 under H2, H4 under H3)
nestedChildToggleNotes.behavior: Click H2 number to toggle visibility of child H3-H4 headings
nestedChildToggleNotes.icon: Uses chevron-right/down icons next to numbers for expand/collapse
nestedChildToggleNotes.defaultExpanded: All children visible by default (DefaultToggle controls initial state)
nestedChildToggleNotes.accordion: Acts like accordion - clicking parent heading expands/collapses children
nestedChildToggleNotes.multiLevel: Works with deep nesting (H2 → H3 → H4 → H5 → H6)

orderedListNotes.typeList: OL creates numbered list (1. 2. 3. vs bullets)
orderedListNotes.semantics: Ordered list appropriate for sequential content (chapters, steps, sections)

examples.name: Minimalist Inline TOC (No Container Box)
examples.description: Clean inline TOC without box styling, blends seamlessly into page content
examples.visualDescription: Plain list with no background, border, or box, purple active links, minimal padding, embedded in content flow
examples.useCase: Inline content navigation, minimalist designs, embedded TOC within articles, lightweight navigation

minimalistNotes.noBoxStyling: boxBg, boxBorder, boxBoxShadow all disabled (openBg: 0, openBorder: 0, openShadow: 0)
minimalistNotes.noPadding: contentPadding and boxPadding all 0 (tight inline layout)
minimalistNotes.blendIn: No visual container, links appear as inline bulleted list in content flow

inlineUsage.placement: Place at top of blog post or within content between paragraphs
inlineUsage.styling: Relies on link colors for visual distinction (purple links stand out)
inlineUsage.compactLinks: Only H2 headings selected (selectorH3-H6 false) for clean short list
inlineUsage.responsivePadding: All padding 0 means no wasted space on mobile

styles.none: Plain list with no decorative lines or borders
styles.style-1: Vertical line to left of each link (::before), highlights active with color/width change
styles.style-2: Border-left on each list item, thicker border for active section
styles.style-3: Horizontal dotted line before nested items (classic book TOC style)
styles.style-4: Vertical line on left of nested items, animated width change on active state

listTypes.UL: Unordered list with bullets (default, most common for TOC)
listTypes.OL: Ordered list with numbers (1. 2. 3., good for chapters/sequential content)

commonPatterns.headingSelectors: Enable specific H1-H6 levels (H2-H3 most common for blogs, all enabled for comprehensive docs)
commonPatterns.smoothScrollTiming: 350-600ms recommended (420ms default feels natural), longer for dramatic scroll effect
commonPatterns.scrollOffsetCalculation: Match fixed header height (80px header = 80px offset to prevent content hiding)
commonPatterns.responsiveCollapse: Set DefaultToggle.xs: false to auto-collapse on mobile, save vertical space

validationRules.selectorH1-H6: At least one must be true (typically H2-H3 for blogs, all for docs)
validationRules.contentSelector: Valid CSS selector (default '#content', can be class .main-article or complex selector)
validationRules.scrollOffset: Number in px (0-150px typical, match header height)
validationRules.fixedOffset: Required when fixedPosition: true (distance from viewport top in px)
validationRules.TableMinHeight: Required when TableSetMinHeight: true (max height before scrollbar appears)
validationRules.Line2Width: Number in px (2-8px for active state, should be > LineWidth)
validationRules.DefaultToggle: Responsive object {md: boolean, sm: boolean, xs: boolean}

warnings: CRITICAL: contentSelector must match actual content container ID/class on page (wrong selector = no headings found)
scrollOffset must account for fixed headers - if header is 80px tall, set scrollOffset: '80' or headings hide behind header
fixedPosition requires container with fixed width (sidebar column), don't use full-width or it breaks layout
TableSetMinHeight only works when content is taller than TableMinHeight (400px content needs 300px max height to show scrollbar)
Custom scrollbar (ScrollBarWidth/Thumb/Track) only works in Webkit browsers (Chrome, Safari, Edge), Firefox shows default
At least one selectorH1-H6 must be true - all false = empty TOC (no headings selected)
ChildToggle only works when multiple heading levels selected (H2+H3 minimum for nesting)
ToggleIcon makes heading clickable to expand/collapse entire TOC - test on mobile where space is limited
Line2Width should be significantly larger than LineWidth (2-3x) for visible active state emphasis
smoothDuration too long (>1000ms) feels sluggish, too short (<300ms) feels jarring, 400-600ms is sweet spot
DefaultToggle.xs: false hides TOC on mobile - ensure it's accessible via another navigation method
fixedOffset calculation: header height + desired padding from top (80px header + 40px padding = 120px offset)
commonMistakes: Using contentSelector: '#content' when actual page uses '.main-content' class (no headings found, empty TOC)
Forgetting scrollOffset with fixed header - headings scroll behind header and are hidden
Setting fixedPosition: true without sidebar container (TOC covers main content, breaks responsive layout)
Using TableSetMinHeight without enough content - if only 3 headings exist, max height doesn't trigger scrollbar
Setting all selectorH1-H6 to false (empty TOC, no headings selected)
Using ChildToggle with only one heading level (e.g., only H2 selected, no children to toggle)
Setting Line2Width smaller than LineWidth (active state looks smaller instead of emphasized)
Not testing mobile DefaultToggle - expanded TOC on mobile can take up entire screen
Using very long smoothDuration (>1500ms) making scroll feel unresponsive
Forgetting to set openTypography: 1 before customizing typography (typography changes don't apply)
bestPractices: For blogs: Select H2-H3 only (clean 2-level hierarchy, not overwhelming)
For documentation: Select all H1-H6 with ChildToggle for comprehensive navigation
Set scrollOffset to match fixed header height + 20px padding (prevents content hiding)
Use fixedPosition with TableSetMinHeight for long articles (sidebar TOC stays visible, scrolls independently)
Set DefaultToggle.xs: false on mobile to save vertical space (collapsed by default, user expands if needed)
Use style-1 or style-2 for modern designs (vertical line indicators, clean active state)
Use style-3 for classic/traditional content (book-style dotted lines, serif fonts)
Set smoothDuration to 420-600ms for comfortable reading experience (not too fast, not too slow)
Use ordered list (OL) for sequential content (chapters, steps), unordered (UL) for general navigation
Add TableDescText for clarity ('Jump to section', 'Navigate chapters') especially when using ToggleIcon
Set Line2Width to 2-3x LineWidth for obvious active state (2px inactive → 6px active = clear emphasis)
Use contentSelector to target specific areas ('.post-content', '#main-article') avoid scanning header/footer headings
Test on mobile - long TOC lists can be overwhelming on small screens, use ToggleIcon or DefaultToggle.xs: false
accessibilityNotes: TOC links must have valid href anchors matching heading IDs (auto-generated by block)
Keyboard navigation: Tab through links, Enter to activate smooth scroll
Screen readers announce 'Table of Contents' heading and list structure (UL/OL semantics)
smoothScroll with reduce-motion: Block respects prefers-reduced-motion CSS media query (instant scroll for users who disable animations)
Focus indicators: Links should have visible :focus styles (browser default or custom)
Color contrast: Link colors must meet WCAG AA (4.5:1 for normal text, 3:1 for active state)
Active state: .is-active-li class provides visual indicator for screen reader users ('Current section')
ToggleIcon: Clickable heading should have aria-expanded attribute for screen readers
Skip link: Consider adding 'Skip to content' link before TOC for keyboard users
performanceConsiderations: Intersection Observer for active state tracking: Efficient, no scroll event listeners needed
Heading ID generation: Happens once on page load, cached for smooth scroll
Smooth scroll: Uses native CSS scroll-behavior: smooth (GPU accelerated, no JS animation loop)
Fixed position: position: fixed is performant (browser compositor layer, no repaints on scroll)
Custom scrollbar: CSS-only (ScrollBarWidth/Thumb/Track), no performance impact
ChildToggle: Uses CSS display toggle, no layout recalculation needed
Large TOC (>50 headings): Consider TableSetMinHeight to limit visible items (reduces initial DOM complexity)
Multiple TOCs: Only one TOC per page recommended (multiple TOCs track active state independently, can confuse users)
Re-scanning: TOC rescans headings on window resize (debounced to 300ms, minimal performance impact)
Anchor ID generation: Uses slugified heading text, cached in data attribute

troubleshooting.problem: TOC is empty, no headings show
troubleshooting.cause: contentSelector doesn't match actual page container, or no headings in selected area
troubleshooting.solution: Inspect page HTML, find actual content container ID/class (#primary, .post-content, etc.), update contentSelector

troubleshooting.cause: scrollOffset is 0 or too small, doesn't account for header height
troubleshooting.solution: Measure header height (e.g., 80px), set scrollOffset: '80' or add 20px padding: scrollOffset: '100'

troubleshooting.problem: Active state doesn't update while scrolling
troubleshooting.cause: Headings don't have IDs, or Intersection Observer not initialized
troubleshooting.solution: Ensure block generates IDs for all headings (check HTML for id='heading-text' attributes), refresh page

troubleshooting.cause: fixedPosition: true without responsive container, or DefaultToggle.xs: true with long list
troubleshooting.solution: Set fixedPosition: false on mobile, or use DefaultToggle.xs: false to auto-collapse

troubleshooting.problem: Scrollbar doesn't appear despite TableSetMinHeight: true
troubleshooting.cause: Content is shorter than TableMinHeight (e.g., 3 headings with 300px height, max height 600px)
troubleshooting.solution: Reduce TableMinHeight to force scrollbar, or only use max height for very long TOCs (>15 headings)

troubleshooting.problem: Child headings don't collapse with ChildToggle
troubleshooting.cause: Only one heading level selected (e.g., only H2, no H3-H6 children to toggle)
troubleshooting.solution: Select at least 2 heading levels (H2 + H3 minimum) for nesting and collapse functionality

troubleshooting.cause: Using Firefox (Webkit scrollbar CSS doesn't work), or ScrollBarWidth: '' empty
troubleshooting.solution: Test in Chrome/Safari/Edge, set ScrollBarWidth: '8' and colors (ScrollBarThumb/Track)

troubleshooting.cause: smoothScroll: false, or conflicting CSS scroll-behavior, or prefers-reduced-motion enabled
troubleshooting.solution: Set smoothScroll: true, check CSS for scroll-behavior overrides, test with animations enabled
